department: Department of Public Works and Government Services (PSPC)
short_summary: The contract is cancelled. The COVID-19 pandemic had posed challenges for the sellers, particularly around the need to implement social distancing and infection control measures. Additionally, the sellers faced supply chain disruptions, something that further impacted their ability to meet the expected deadlines. The contracting authority has therefore agreed to cancel the contract and restart the procurement process.
description: This contract notice is for a mandatory procurement notice. The notice is posted to let the industry know that contract will be cancelled and restart procurement process. The total price is CND$0.00
tags: Department of Public Works and Government Services (PSPC)
full_summary: # Notice of Cancelled Procurement: NPP Chemistry and Allergen Sampling and Testing ## Reference Information * Reference Number: WS4011646064-Doc4011673524 * Amendment Number: 2 * Solicitation Number: WS4011646064 * Publication Date: May 16, 2023 * Tender Closing Date: May 18, 2023, 2:00 PM ET ## Notice Status * Tender Status: Cancelled ## Procurement Details * Procurement Method: Competitive - Open Bidding * Selection Criteria: Lowest Price * UNSPSC Code: 81141704 - Production statistics collection or analysis services * UNSPSC Description: Statistical data collection and analysis services for production * Procurement Category: Services - SRV * Trade Agreements: Not Applicable * Regions of Opportunity: Not Applicable * Regions of Delivery: Canada ## Government Contact * Contracting Entity Name: Department of Public Works and Government Services (PSPC) * Contracting Entity Address: 11 Laurier St, Phase III, Place du Portage, Gatineau, Quebec K1A 0S5 * Government Contact Person: Jeremy Gagne, SPAC/PSPC, jeremy.gagne@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca ## Notice Description This notice is to inform industry of the cancellation of a potential upcoming Request for Proposal (RFP) for the procurement of sample collection and laboratory services related to targeted chemical and allergenic hazards found in food products. The original intent was to allow industry additional time to undergo method validation and accreditation, and to identify potential methods of interest and assess capability for both method accreditation and sample volume. However, a Request for Proposal (RFP) is no longer anticipated. No response to this notice is required. Additional information about potential future procurements related to these requirements will be communicated separately. ![ Original Contractor’s documentScreenshot captured with Snagit. ![endif]--> Screenshot of original contractor’s document](https://i.imgur.com/3sc9yPb.png)_rewards. js : Gagne, Jeremy (SPAC/PSPC) is the contact person for this notice. His email address is jeremy.gagne@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca. All other contact information has been removed as it was unnecessary. |#()[" amenientarily],_t
